content: TITLE: Running Vox Uristi in Command-Line Mode on Linux DESCRIPTION: Command for exporting a Dwarf Fortress map with specified altitude bounds. This example exports the map from altitude -2 to 17 and saves it as 'fortress.vox'. SOURCE: https://github.com/plule/vox-uristi/blob/main/site/_pages/usage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` vox-uristi export --low -2 --high 17 fortress.vox ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Running Vox Uristi with Cargo DESCRIPTION: Standard Rust commands for building and running the Vox Uristi project using Cargo. SOURCE: https://github.com/plule/vox-uristi/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ``` cargo build cargo run ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Vox Uristi Help Information DESCRIPTION: Command to display the full list of available options and commands for Vox Uristi on Linux. SOURCE: https://github.com/plule/vox-uristi/blob/main/site/_pages/usage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` vox-uristi --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Release Process for Vox Uristi DESCRIPTION: Steps to release a new version of Vox Uristi, including updating version in Cargo.toml, tagging, and pushing to repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/plule/vox-uristi/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. Update `Cargo.toml` to the target release `` and commit 2. `git tag v` 3. `git push --tags` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown/HTML Landing Page with Download Links and Media DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the structure of the landing page with download buttons, video embeds, navigation links, and feature roadmap for the Vox Uristi tool. It combines Markdown and HTML to create a responsive layout with visual examples. SOURCE: https://github.com/plule/vox-uristi/blob/main/site/index.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- title: "☼Vox Uristi☼" layout: splash permalink: / header: overlay_filter: 0.5 overlay_image: /assets/gallery/banner.jpg --- [ Download for Windows]({%include latest-download-windows.html%}){: .btn .btn--success .btn--x-large} [ Download for Linux]({%include latest-download-linux.html%}){: .btn .btn--success .btn--x-large} [ View on Github](https://github.com/plule/vox-uristi){: .btn .btn--primary .btn--x-large} **Vox Uristi** exports Dwarf Fortress maps in a voxel format to create beautiful rendering of your fortresses. It uses DFHack to read the fortress data and export it in the `.vox` format. The resulting file can then be opened in a software such as MagicaVoxel to render it. | | | | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | *Shàmmanór, a fortress by rockjitsu* | *Heavenfall, a fortress by Horrigant* | [ Usage](/vox-uristi/usage){: .btn .btn--primary} [ Gallery](/vox-uristi/gallery){: .btn .btn--primary} [ Tips](/vox-uristi/tips){: .btn .btn--primary} [ Changelog](/vox-uristi/changelog){: .btn .btn--primary} ## Features/Roadmap ### Next - ☑ Base building blocks (walls, floors, fortifications) - ☑ Water, magma and grass - ☑ Basic material colors - ☑ Directional ramps - ☑ Rough/Smooth floor representation - ☑ Basic tree support, inaccurate but good enough - ☑ Most construction items (doors, windows, bars, bridges, furnitures, workshops) - ☑ Flows, waves and mist - ☑ Seasonal plants - ☑ Detailed materials (metallic, water, light emission) - ☑ Building content (books on bookcases, items in workshops, ...) - ☑ Spatters - ☑ Export the buildings as individual selectable objects - ☑ Split the export into useful layers - ☐ Item state (opened/closed) - ☐ Rails - ☐ Easier/interactive export ### Maybe some day - ☐ Export some animations - ☐ Customizable models - ☐ Support different voxel resolutions ## Other Dwarf Fortress visualisation tools Vox Uristi is only intended to make one-off renders of fortresses. Other tools can be used for different kind of usage or render. For real-time isometric rendering: [stonesense](https://docs.dfhack.org/en/stable/docs/tools/stonesense.html). For real-time 3D rendering: [Armok Vision](https://github.com/RosaryMala/armok-vision). For one-off render of the world map: [VoxelFortress](https://github.com/RosaryMala/VoxelFortress/releases/tag/v1.0.0). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Gallery YAML Configuration for Dwarf Fortress Screenshots DESCRIPTION: YAML structure defining image galleries with URLs, paths and titles for different Dwarf Fortress locations. Includes configurations for main fortresses like Ikûl Tikis, Northbridge, and various other locations. SOURCE: https://github.com/plule/vox-uristi/blob/main/site/_pages/gallery.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` title: "Gallery" layout: single permalink: /gallery nest: - url: /assets/gallery/nest/iso.jpg image_path: /assets/gallery/nest/iso.jpg title: Isometric view of the Ziggurat - url: /assets/gallery/nest/coast.jpg image_path: /assets/gallery/nest/coast.jpg title: View from the coast - url: /assets/gallery/nest/top.jpg image_path: /assets/gallery/nest/top.jpg title: Top floor - url: /assets/gallery/nest/foggy.jpg image_path: /assets/gallery/nest/foggy.jpg title: Foggy render - url: /assets/gallery/nest/general.jpg image_path: /assets/gallery/nest/general.jpg title: General view - url: /assets/gallery/nest/ground.jpg image_path: /assets/gallery/nest/ground.jpg title: View from the ground ```
